title: UK IS-8 Quarterly Update Q4 2025
summary: Quarterly update summarising UK Industrial Strategy (IS-8) delivery and allocations in Q4 2025: >£9bn allocated via UKRI to IS-8 sectors; AI Growth Zones, Semiconductor Centre (King's Cross), DRIVE35 expansion, major regional private investments, planning and energy reforms to accelerate delivery.
deliveryMilestones: £9bn+ directed to IS-8 via UKRI four-year allocations
AI Growth Zones in North & South Wales announced (5,000+ jobs over next decade, potential £124bn private investment)
New Semiconductor Centre planned in King’s Cross, London
Drive35 expansion to £4bn to 2035 for zero-emissions vehicle manufacturing
Wylfa selected as first SMR site with £2.5bn+ funding
New Connections Accelerator Service pilot to speed grid connections for priority projects
Network Charging Compensation Scheme to reduce electricity network costs for eligible businesses (from April 2026)

regionalHighlights.Birmingham: Regional Investment Summit commitments >£10bn; Knowledge Quarter support
regionalHighlights.Wales: AI Growth Zones, £1.4bn private investment confirmed
regionalHighlights.Oxford-Cambridge: £500m investment package for homes, infrastructure and R&D at Ellison Institute

policyActions: UKRI targeted grants and institute funding
Planning and Infrastructure Act reforms to accelerate delivery
Business environment reforms to reduce administrative burdens
Skills investment via Technical Excellence Colleges and Youth Guarantee packages
Investor mobilisation (Sterling 20 partnership) and procurement innovations (Advance Market Commitments)
